snippet: The death of Dr. Modupeh Cole at a Doctors Without Borders treatment center was a blow to the nation’s ability to stem the disease.
abstract: Dr Modupeh Cole is second leading Sierra Leone doctor to die from Ebola epidemic sweeping across West Africa; loss of Cole is described as significant by health officials in a country with a severe shortage of well-trained doctors, especially coming two weeks after the death of Dr Sheik Humarr Khan, virologist who was leading the fight against the disease in eastern Sierra Leone, where it has flourished.

byline.contributor: Clair MacDougall contributed reporting from Monrovia, Liberia.

lead_paragraph: The death of Dr. Modupeh Cole at a Doctors Without Borders treatment center was a blow to the nation’s ability to stem the disease.

headline.main: Sierra Leone Again Loses a Top Doctor to Ebola
headline.print_headline: Sierra Leone Again Loses a Top Doctor to Ebola

keywords.value: Economic Community of West African States (Ecowas)
